name: 反标率低导致ECO中断
descriptions: Q7：read_timing_data导入数据后反标率很低，可能的原因有哪些？ A：1. 首先应对所有输入数据进行检查，检查给xtop 的verilog 文件是否与sta 工具吃的是同一个文件 2. 检查一下在read_timing_data 时是否有添加option "-memory_saving_mode",以及从STA 工具dump timing data 时，是否source 了turbo mode 脚本，当前XTop中的turbo/pro mode，会对这些pin 的clock 信息及些不必要的attribute 进行reduce，在这两个mode 中，dump 数据时只会dump violation pin 及vio pin 前后3-5 级的pin info，所以可能会导致反标率(annotated ratio)的下降，目前XTop 是当反标率(annotated ratio)低于90%以下时，工具会中止继续进行eco，针对这种情况，建议使用normal mode dump数据，或使用turbo mode dump 数据时，添加option "-include_tran_vio"和"-include_cap_vio".

name: XTop与P*T的Leakage power计算差异
descriptions: Q10: 为什么XTop 计算的Leakage power 跟P*T 对不上？ A: 首先leakage power 的计算与state 强相关，cell 工作在不同的state condition 下会呈现不同的leakage power value。 STA leakage power 计算行为：在STA 中，一个cell 的leakage power 的计算极其复杂，他与state probability 强相关，大致计算方法为：1. 对于一个4 输入的combination cell 来说，它的state 可能为2^4，共16 种condition，如下表。2. 在STA 工具中会分别计算上述16 种状态下的leakage power value，并与其对应的state probability 相乘，即每一个condition 的leakage power 为：state （cell leakage power） = leakage power value * state probability。3. 根据上式中的计算结果，将16 中state 下的leakage power 相加，最后获得该cell 在当前design 中的leakage power。 XTop leakage power 计算行为：首先因当前XTop 中的大部分pin attribute 及cell attribute 均使用dump 脚本得来，但对于state probability 这一指标，在P*T 中并没有相关attribute 能够使用脚本进行dump，故当前XTop 中的leakage power 计算方法无法做到与P*T 中完全一致，但总体leakage power 的变化趋势可以做到与P*T 中一致。1. 因无法像P*T 中一样对一个cell 进行by state 的leakage power 的精准计算，故当前XTop 中的leakage 评估较为粗糙。2. 在进行cell swap 时，工具会选择一个更高阈值电压的cell进行leakage power 评估，目前只会粗糙的取遇到的第一个state，作为该cell 的leakage power 进行比较。

name: Leakage power
description: Leakage power 是指在静态条件下，电路中由于晶体管漏电流而消耗的功率。其计算与cell的工作状态（state）及其对应的state probability密切相关。

name: State probability
description: State probability 是指在特定工作条件下，cell处于某一状态的概率。在STA中，state probability用于加权计算不同状态下的leakage power值。

name: Cell swap
description: Cell swap 是指在设计优化过程中，将一个cell替换为另一个具有不同电气特性的cell的操作。在XTop中，该操作会基于state probability进行leakage power的评估。

name: Cell swap
description: 在设计优化过程中，将一个cell替换为另一个具有不同电气特性的cell的操作。
effect: 影响cell的leakage power评估，可能导致与P*T工具的结果差异。

name: XTop无法精确计算Leakage power
reasons: XTop无法获取P*T中的state probability attribute
XTop的leakage power评估方法较为粗糙
description: XTop中的leakage power计算方法无法与P*T完全一致，因为P*T中没有state probability的attribute可供脚本dump，导致XTop只能采用简化的计算方式。

name: Q12
descriptions:
当前XTop中在leakage opt阶段，swap cell的行为是否会挪动cell？
首先在legal阶段是否会挪动cell，与是否only_swap_cell无关，只与当时的placement constraint有关。如果用户设置了xtop > set_placement_constraint -max_displacement {0 0}，则工具将不会挪动cell。否则即使在opt leakage阶段，就算使用了option -swap_vt_only，工具也可能在某些特殊的vt rule（先进工艺下，因double/triple pattern制造工艺，会存在同一类型cell的LVT和HVT的出pin位置不一致或底层metal不在同一color上）的要求下，轻微的挪动cell，但这种挪动cell的幅度很小，基本在1-20个site之间。

name: double/triple pattern制造工艺

name: -force
usage: Force to write out macro commands and only the illegal ones are written in atomic format.

name: -reorder
usage: Put the forced output commands at the end of the output sequence.

usage: Write out atomic commands for each action.

name: Macro Command Errors
reasons: Buffered pins not in same logic hierarchy during buffer insertion/split net
Split net with inverter
Insert individual inverter during buffer chain insertion
Insert AND/OR cell as buffer in post-mask eco
description:
By default, macro commands will be output. However, it will report errors when following happens:
--Buffered pins are not in the same logic hierarchy when insert buffer or split net.
--Split net with inverter.
--Insert individual inverter when insert buffer chain.
--Insert AND/OR cell as buffer in post-mask eco.

name: Macro Command Handling in ECO
descriptions:
By default, macro commands will be output. However, it will report errors when following happens:
--Buffered pins are not in the same logic hierarchy when insert buffer or split net.
--Split net with inverter.
--Insert individual inverter when insert buffer chain.
--Insert AND/OR cell as buffer in post-mask eco.

In these cases, please write out atomic eco commands instead of macro commands with option -write_atomic_cmd. Or force to dump the macro commands with option -force. Here if -force option is used, atomic commands (which can be run by source command) will be dumped only for these particular actions. The atomic commands will be mixed with other macro commands. For some specific reasons, if these mixed commands are not convenient, please use -reorder option to put all the atomic commands at the end of the output sequence.

name: Force Macro Command Output
description: Forces the output of macro commands even when illegal actions are detected, writing only the illegal ones in atomic format.
effect: Atomic commands are generated for specific illegal actions and mixed with macro commands.

name: Reorder Output Sequence
description: Moves all forced output commands to the end of the output sequence.
effect: Atomic commands are grouped at the end of the output file for easier processing.

name: Atomic Command Generation
description: Generates atomic commands for each action instead of macro commands.
effect: Ensures compatibility with source command execution for specific ECO operations.

name: 无fail reason的情况
reasons: 不是reference pin
不在扫描范围内（如clock/特殊点）
多轮运行被清掉
已是best solution但修不好
description: fail reason原则上是try的最后一个candidates上产生的reason，但某些情况也会做调整。如果没有fail reason，一般有以下4种情况：1. 不是reference pin，2. 因为某些原因不在扫描范围内，比如clock/特殊的点， 3. run了多轮被清掉了（可以参考俊葳写的FAQ文档： xtop_fail_reason.docx）， 4. 已经是best solution，但仍然修不好。

name: GBA values pessimism
descriptions: Generally, it is recommended to only fix violations on paths since GBA values are always pessimistic and will be over-fixed. But paths cannot cover all the violations, and it needs iterations to fix all the violations. If the concern is the completion rate, and the cost of over-fix is not that important, you can try this command.

name: GBA slack
description: GBA (Global Buffer Analysis) slack is a pessimistic estimate used in timing analysis, which may lead to over-fixing when used directly.

name: Fix setup violations using paths
description: This operation fixes setup violations by analyzing paths through pins and using the worst slack of paths instead of GBA slack.
effect: Improves timing closure by addressing path-based violations, potentially reducing over-fixing compared to GBA-based methods.

scenario/timing type skipped
description: Paths with slack below threshold or skipped scenarios are ignored

name: partial_hold_fix
descriptions: If violations are not completely fixed, statistics of fail reasons are reported. Use report_fail_reasons to review details.

name: fix_hold_violations_process
description: Executes hold violation fixing on specified paths
effect: Reports gain, area, density variations; logs fail reasons if unresolved

name: unreasonable_negative_slack
description: Threshold value below which paths are ignored during hold violation fixing

name: GBA
description: Global Buffer Assignment (GBA) is a method for fixing timing violations by pessimistically identifying violations, which may lead to over-fixing and extra resource costs. It has low flexibility in selecting violations to fix.

name: PBA
description: Path-Based Assignment (PBA) is a method for fixing timing violations by analyzing individual timing paths. It has low coverage when there are many violations and requires more memory and time for processing.

name: insert buffer chain
description: Inserts a buffer chain to increase delay for hold violations. Only allowed at net sinks.
effect: Increases delay to resolve hold violations

name: insert dummy cell
description: Adds a dummy cell to a net to increase wire load for very small hold violations.
effect: Increases wire load to resolve hold violations

name: size down cells
description: Reduces cell size to weaken drive strength for hold violations.
effect: Decreases drive strength to resolve hold violations

name: size cell to different vt
description: Adjusts cell size to different threshold voltages for hold violations.
effect: Modifies drive strength to resolve hold violations

name: size cell to different channel length
description: Adjusts cell size to different channel lengths for hold violations.
effect: Modifies drive strength to resolve hold violations

name: remove redundant buffers
description: Removes redundant buffers or inverter pairs to resolve setup violations.
effect: Reduces unnecessary buffers to improve timing

name: split net
description: Splits a net to resolve setup violations.
effect: Improves timing by modifying net structure

name: size cell
description: Adjusts cell size to resolve setup violations.
effect: Modifies drive strength to improve timing

name: insert buffer
description: Inserts a buffer to resolve setup violations.
effect: Increases delay to improve timing

name: -max_cluster_loader_count
usage: Controls buffer count during hold fix to reduce buffer usage and improve fix results

name: -fix_timing_window
usage: Enables a timing window adjustment to improve setup margin and fix results when many 'break_setup' reasons exist

name: new violations introduced
reasons: The normal flow detects new violations or worsens existing violations
description: If the current solution introduces new violations or worsens existing ones, the solution will be abandoned with this failure reason marked on pins

name: buffer count optimization
descriptions: When buffer count is not optimized as expected, the -max_cluster_loader_count flag is suggested to be turned on to reduce buffer count and improve fix results

name: break_setup reasons
descriptions: After a normal fix, if there are many 'break_setup' reasons in the summary, the -fix_timing_window flag can be turned on to improve setup margin and fix results

name: Turbo/Pro mode速度提升数值
descriptions: Q11：Turbo/Pro mode 对速度的提升大致有多少？ A：首先应明确Turbo/Pro mode 的区别，turbo mode 是在sta 中dump timing data 阶段，通过减少不必要的数据提取，进而缩短runtime，而pro mode 是在turbo mode 的数据基础上，对工具内部数据结构及内存管理机制的优化，在turbo mode 减少runtime 的基础上，进一步降低mem cost，也就是说，在runtime 上，turbo 和pro mode 基本无差别，具体的turbo 和pro mode 的速度提升数值，可以参考introduction slide 中的第4 页intro_slide。

name: Turbo/Pro mode
description: Turbo mode通过减少数据提取缩短runtime，Pro mode在Turbo基础上优化内存管理，两者在runtime上无差别但Pro mode降低内存成本

name: 参考intro_slide
description: 通过查阅introduction slide的第4页获取Turbo/Pro mode的具体速度提升数值
effect: 获取准确的速度提升数据用于分析

name: over-fixing GBA violations
descriptions: Generally, it is recommended to only fix violations on paths since GBA values are always pessimistic and will be over-fixed. But paths cannot cover all the violations, and it needs iterations to fix all the violations. If the concern is the completion rate, and the cost of over-fix is not that important, you can try this command.

effect: May cause over-fixing due to pessimistic GBA values, but can be used when completion rate is prioritized over over-fix cost.

name: filler回填问题
descriptions: Q13: 如果design 已经插满了filler 单元，xtop 做完eco 能自动回填吗？ A: 针对以上情况，xtop 在不同mode 下的行为存在着区别，首先 在normal mode 下： 如果当前design中已经插满了filler，正常情况下，工具只能进行swap vt，即不改变原有cell 位置，只进行LVT/SVT/HVT 的互换，但在某些先进工艺下，因vt rule 的存在，不同vt cell 可能也存在着legal 时会挪动位置的现象，因 此可能swap vt 也做不了 综上，为了提升工具的兼容性，减少用户再回到pr tool 中remove filler 后再dump db 的迭代时间，xtop 提供了一个command："set_removable_fillers",帮助用户直接在xtop 中将filler cell 移除，具体用法如下： xtop > link_reference_library ... xtop > set_removable_fillers {FILLX2 FILLX4 DCAPX8 DCAPX12} xtop > import_design Note: 该命令必须在link_reference_library 之后，import_design 之前进行设置，否则无效 设置了该命令后，工具会自动移除当前design 中的filler cell，此时即可正常插入cell，且在写出的脚本中，插入功能cell 位置的filler cell 也会添加对应命令进行移除，但工具仅会对filler 进行移除，不会进行回填，大致效果如下图： ![使用set_removable_fillers指令后工具不会进行filler回填的示意图](resources/images/_xtop_faq_v3/img_page0055_fig0001.png) 如上图所示，对一个buffer 进行size up 后，实际D16 buffer 右侧还空余了一部分空间，但此时xtop 不会进行filler 回填，将该区域填满，用户可返回到pr tool 中，进行此区域的回填。 在postmask eco mode 下： 工具可以自动的进行filler cell 的回填。
